translated: Points of Controversy
The Great Fifty
The Ninth Section

analyzed: na yathā cittassa kāya kammanti kathā
translated: The Discussion of Bodily Action Not in Accord with Thought
“Is bodily action not in accordance with thought?”
“Yes.”
“Is bodily action of one who is not touching …
bodily action of one who is mindless?”🔽“No.”

analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  nanu sa phassakassa kāya kammam pe
translated: “Then is bodily action of one who is touching …
bodily action of one who is mindful?”
“Yes.”

original: Hañci saphassakassa kāyakammaṁ …pe…🔽sacittakassa kāyakammaṁ, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci sa phassakassa kāya kammam pe  sa cittakassa kāyakamma no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Then is bodily action of one who is touching …
bodily action of one who is mindful, and yet is it not the case that it should be said that it is not in accordance with thought?”
“Is bodily action not in accordance with thought?”
“Yes.”🔽“Is bodily action of one who is not turning away …

original: Anāvaṭṭentassa kāyakammaṁ …pe… appaṇidahantassa kāyakammanti?🔽Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe…🔽nanu āvaṭṭentassa kāyakammaṁ …pe… paṇidahantassa kāyakammanti?
analyzed: an āvaṭṭentassa kāya kammam pe a paṇidahantassa kāya kammanti  na ha ivam vattabbe pe  nanu āvaṭṭentassa kāya kammam pe paṇidahantassa kāya kammanti
translated: bodily action of one who is not inclining?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci āvaṭṭentassa kāyakammaṁ …pe… paṇidahantassa kāyakammaṁ, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: āmantā  hañci āvaṭṭentassa kāya kamma pe paṇidahantassa kāya kamma no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “No.”🔽“Then is bodily action of one who is turning away …
bodily action of one who is inclining, and yet is it not the case that it should be said that it is not in accordance with thought?”
“Is bodily action not in accordance with consciousness?”
“Yes.”

original: Nanu kāyakammaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ cittena sahajātaṁ cittena saha ekuppādanti?
analyzed: nanu kāya kammam citta samuṭṭhānam cittena sahajātam cittena saha eka uppādanti
translated: “Isn’t bodily action originated by consciousness, born of consciousness, caused by consciousness, and conditioned by consciousness?”
“Yes.”

original: Hañci kāyakammaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ cittena sahajātaṁ cittena saha ekuppādaṁ, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci kāya kammam citta samuṭṭhānam cittena sahajātam cittena saha ekuppāda no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Then you should not say
that bodily action is not in accordance with consciousness.”
“Is bodily action not in accordance with consciousness?”
“Yes.”

original: Na abhikkamitukāmo abhikkamati, na paṭikkamitukāmo paṭikkamati, na āloketukāmo āloketi, na viloketukāmo viloketi, na samiñjitukāmo samiñjeti, na pasāretukāmo pasāretīti?
analyzed: na abhikkamitu kāmaḥ abhikkamati na paṭikkamitu kāmaḥ paṭikkamati na āloketu kāmaḥ āloketi na viloketu kāmaḥ viloketi na samiñjitu kāmaḥ samiñjeti na pasāretu kāmaḥ pasāreti iti
translated: “One who wants to go forward doesn’t go forward. One who wants to go back doesn’t go back. One who wants to look around doesn’t look around. One who wants to bend down doesn’t bend down. One who wants to stretch out doesn’t stretch out.”
“You shouldn’t say so.”

original: Nanu abhikkamitukāmo abhikkamati, paṭikkamitukāmo paṭikkamati, āloketukāmo āloketi, viloketukāmo viloketi, samiñjitukāmo samiñjeti, pasāretukāmo pasāretīti?
analyzed: nanu abhikkamitu kāmaḥ abhikkamati paṭikkamitu kāmaḥ paṭikkamati āloketu kāmaḥ āloketi viloketu kāmaḥ viloketi samiñjitu kāmaḥ samiñjeti pasāretu kāmaḥ pasāreti iti
translated: “One who wants to go forward goes forward. One who wants to go back goes back. One who wants to look around looks around. One who wants to bend down bends down. One who wants to stretch out stretches out.”
“Yes.”🔽“Then you should not say that

original: pasāretukāmo pasāreti, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: pasāretu kāmaḥ pasāreti no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: If you want to extend it, you extend it. You can’t say that
it’s not in accordance with the mind.
You shouldn’t say that
it’s not in accordance with the mind.

original: Āmantā.🔽Nanu atthi koci “aññatra gacchissāmī”ti aññatra gacchati …pe…
analyzed: āmantā  nanu atthi koci aññatra gacchissāmi iti aññatra gacchati pe
translated: You’re stuck.🔽“But doesn’t someone go elsewhere, saying, ‘I’ll go elsewhere’? …

analyzed: aññam pasāressāmi iti aññam pasāreti iti
translated: Doesn’t someone extend it elsewhere, saying, ‘I’ll extend it elsewhere’?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci atthi koci “aññatra gacchissāmī”ti aññatra gacchati …pe…
analyzed: āmantā  hañci atthi koci aññatra gacchissāmi iti aññatra gacchati pe
translated: You’re stuck.🔽“Well then, does someone go elsewhere, saying, ‘I’ll go elsewhere’? …

original: “aññaṁ pasāressāmī”ti aññaṁ pasāreti, tena vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: aññam pasāressāmi iti aññam pasāreti tena vata re vattabbe
translated: Does someone extend it elsewhere, saying, ‘I’ll extend it elsewhere’? You can’t say that

analyzed: na yathā cittassa kāya kammanti 🔽na yathā cittassa kāya kammanti kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: it’s not in accordance with the mind.”🔽The discussion is finished.
